DOC.brief_summary: Research Question : Do Aromatase Inhibitors Decrease Intestinal Calcium Absorption ? Study Design : Postmenopausal woman early stage breast cancer initiate aromatase inhibitor adjuvant therapy participate two-month study . The primary study outcome change intestinal calcium absorption follow therapy . Secondary outcome change bone resorption marker musculoskeletal sign symptom initiation therapy . We interview woman review medical record determine eligibility . Eligible subject undergo two calcium absorption study . The first study determine baseline calcium absorption , second study occur take aromatase inhibitor daily least 6 week . Women present research unit early morning receive oral intravenous stable calcium tracer breakfast . Over next 24 hour , collect urine measurement calcium content . During inpatient stay , assess musculoskeletal symptom questionnaire joint examination . Each woman complete four-day diet diary twice study .
